name: Any subdomains, except listed
description:
Rule to match all subdomains from a domain "yourdomain.com" that are not used, so you can redirect them to the main home page using .htaccess

Just replace "yourdomain.com" with your domain name.
content:
Rule to match all subdomains from a domain "yourdomain.com" that are not used, so you can redirect them to the main home page using .htaccess
Example:

# Permanently Redirect ANY subdomains to www, except these subdomains: www and clients
RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} ^(?!www|clients)([a-zA-Z0-9\-\_]*).yourdomain.com$ [NC]
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ http://www.yourdomain.com/$1 [L,R=301]

www.yourdomain.com
clients.yourdomain.com
fsd-fs.yourdomain.com
a_a.yourdomain.com
dfg.yourdomain.com
awww.yourdomain.com

As you see, all the highlighted domain names will be redirected to the domain in the "RewriteRule" line.

Just replace "yourdomain.com" with your domain name.
author: AuralSolutions
